title.narrative: Provision of life saving sexual and reproductive health services, gender–based violence response and mental health and psychosocial support in Chin, Kayah, Mon, and Shan (northern and southern) States

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving sexual- and reproductive health and gender-based violence assistance to internally displaced persons and host community members in Chin, Kayah, Mon and Shan. This UNFPA project procures emergency reproductive health kits, provides conditional cash transfers, distributes menstrual hygiene management and dignity kits, strengthens community-based mechanisms, supports women- and girl-friendly safe spaces, and deploys mobile medical clinics. The sexual- and reproductive health component of the project provides life-saving assistance to 10,600 people, including 9,615 women, 250 men, 735 children, and 212 persons with disabilities. The gender-based violence component provides life-saving assistance to 24,957, including 19,017 women, 5,000 men, 940 children, and 499 persons with disabilities.
